                            <dd> Kia’s 4Q results slightly missed consensus, due to greater incentive spends in the US market. Warranty provisioning swelled by KRW420b as the won ended the quarter lower (by KRW158/USD q-q), but should be reversed in 1Q25.
</dd><dd> Ten new vehicles are scheduled for launch by 1Q26, which should help offset the burden of US incentives. Kia’s 2025 business plan assumes a forex rate of KRW1,320/USD. A further weakening of won would be an alpha factor.
</dd>
                        </dl>
                    </td>
